description:
Oliver to Osoyoos - the trail follows the Okanagan river channel from Oliver to the marsh area at the head of Osoyoos Lake. 
By travelling  7km utilizing No 22 road and highway 97 you could get to Osoyoos from the end of the trail. Note Highway 97 is rather busy though.
There are no hills it's flat all the way. About 10 km of the trail at the Oliver end is paved.
It's a trip through wine country with orchard and vineyard views. There are places one could detour to a winery especially near either end or the trail.
For much of distance trail exists on both sides of the river.
directions:
Oliver - north or Oliver towards Vaseux Lake, parking is opposite the Oasis Gas station also near the entry to J Triggs winery. (Tuc UL Nuit Rd).
There is a sign in parking area point to trail which starts on the other side of the bridge and follows the river.
In Oliver (save 5km) you can park at Lions Park and find the trail next to the river.
From Osoyoos go north to No 22. Rd then follow it east to a parking area just before the bridge
title: Oliver to Osoyoos
